Housekeeping. There are tables, chairs, and lumber in the corner of the front sheep enclosure. These items could cause
leg injuries to the sheep if they become entangled. Housing facilities for animals must be kept clean and in good repair to
protect the animals from injury. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept clean, in good repair, and that unnecessary
items such as chairs, tables, and lumber are removed from enclosures to protect the health of the animals. Correct by
February 25, 2023.
This inspection was conducted with the licensee and exit interview was conducted with a facility representative.
End Section
